definition: to bend/bent/a bend/a turn (in the road etc)/CL:道[dao4]
the back of a body or object/to turn one's back/to hide something from/to learn by heart/to recite from memory/unlucky (slang)/hard of hearing
to be burdened/to carry on the back or shoulder

sentences.english: His figure bent earthwards with hard work.
sentences.chinese: 因爲工作辛苦，他已經彎腰駝背了。

sentences.english: He had a long, thin body and the scholar's stoop.
sentences.chinese: 他身材瘦長並且象學者一樣彎腰駝背。

sentences.english: And as with slumping, over-arching can also be a simple postural habit.
sentences.chinese: 就像彎腰駝背，過度挺直也可能只是一種習慣性姿勢。

sentences.english: This is because taller people have a greater tendency to slouch.
sentences.chinese: 這是因爲越是高大的人約有彎腰駝背的傾向。
